formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Let taxable income be T, lower rate r_1, higher rate r_2, and threshold b. Montana’s two-rate structure is: Tax components: Lower-bracket portion: \( \text{LB} = \min(T,\, b)\times r_1 \) Upper-bracket portion: \( \text{UB} = \max(T - b,\, 0)\times r_2 \) Total tax before credits: \( \text{Tax} = \text{LB} + \text{UB} \) Marginal rate: \( \text{MR} = \begin{cases} r_1, & T \le b \\ r_2, & T > b \end{cases} \) Effective rate (if \(T>0\)): \( \text{ER} = \dfrac{\text{Tax}}{T} \)
